pr_title: [FLINK-16264][table] Fix ConnectTableDescriptor loose time attribute bug

timeline.message: [FLINK-16264][table] Fix ConnectTableDescriptor loose time attribute bug

timeline.bodyText:
I think we can add a verification in org.apache.flink.table.client.gateway.local.ExecutionContextTest#testTemporalTables to check that the tableEnv.from("EnrichmentSource").getTableSchema contains the rowtime field. It can cover the bug path.
It's not clear what the purpose of this test.
timeline.author: wuchong
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,56 @@

+public class ConnectTableDescriptorTest {

replies.bodyText:
There is no rowtime field in tableEnv.from("EnrichmentSource").getSchema. Rowtime field needs special handle in connector codes when translate select ... query.
This test is just for making sure CatalogTable should be same to properties.
replies.author: JingsongLi

replies.bodyText: There should be a rowtime field in tableEnv.from("EnrichmentSource").getSchema, because DummyTableSourceFactory in sql-client handles this.
replies.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText:
Maybe not.
It is catalog table, not ConnectorCatalogTable.
Real invoking is in StreamTableSourceScan.translateToPlan, it is hard to validate it.
replies.author: JingsongLi

replies.bodyText: OK, it is from SQL-CLI, it is ConnectorCatalogTable now, added test.
replies.author: JingsongLi

timeline.bodyText: Why do you change this? Is it a mistake?
timeline.author: wuchong

replies.bodyText: Yes, SchemaValidator.deriveRowtimeAttributes need properties contains TableSchema.
replies.author: JingsongLi

replies.bodyText: The class was createTableSource(properties), we should revert to that properties.
replies.author: JingsongLi
